page.title: 04HOUSING IN SANDWICK
page.content: Sandwick has a total of 283 houses. The majority of these are clustered in compact groups throughout the district. Others on more solitary sites are built on the crofts which they occupy or because of the charming views they command. The types of houses vary from the traditional stone built cottage to the more modern timber-framed building of today. Many of the older and smaller houses have been enlarged and modernised. Thirty Norwegian-type wooden houses solved the housing problems of the early 1970's. During the oil boom in the 1970's thirty houses were built in Sandwick to accommodate pilots, engineers and airport staff from Sumburgh Airport. These houses have either been acquired now by the Council or rented.
